node.title: Yes, It’s Snowing in Hawaii. No, It’s Not That Weird.
node.alt: An observatory at the summit of Mauna Kea on the Big Island of Hawaii was covered with snow on Thursday.
node.description: The National Weather Service said roughly a foot of snow was expected to fall on the Big Island summits. “We do get snow there pretty much every year,” one local meteorologist said.
node.content: ["When the National Weather Service predicted that Hawaii could get more than 12 inches of snow over the weekend, the mere idea led to dramatic headlines, and thoughts of snow blanketing the beaches of Waikiki and surfers shivering in heavy boots and parkas.", "But the wintry forecast tells a different story.", "The snow is expected to fall on the Big Island summits, which rise to well over 11,000 feet \u2014 not an uncommon elevation for snow to fall, even on a tropical island.", "The peaks of Mauna Loa and Mauna Kea, where snow had been falling since Friday, rise to about 14,000 feet and often experience snow, according to local forecasters. The summits are home to space observatories. Visitors traveling to the peak of Mauna Kea are advised to use only four-wheel-drive vehicles because of the steep terrain.", "\u201cBear in mind, there is no one who lives up there,\u201d said Maureen Ballard, a Weather Service meteorologist in Honolulu. \u201cWe do get snow there pretty much every year.\u201d", "On social media, some locals expressed exasperation with the breathless reactions of those on the mainland.", "\u201cGuys. Guys. Calm down,\u201d one woman wrote on Twitter. \u201cI was born and raised on the Big Island of Hawaii. We get snow on the top of Mauna Kea almost every winter.\u201d", "Still, a prediction of snow for Hawaii when much of the country had no such advisories surprised meteorologists around the country.", "To illustrate the contrast, the Weather Service posted a map of the United States showing states where it had been hundreds or even thousands of days since a blizzard warning had been issued. The last time there was a blizzard warning in Hawaii was 2018, Ms. Ballard said.", "The service warned people not to travel in the area unless there was an emergency.", "\u201cTravel should be restricted to emergencies only,\u201d the agency said. \u201cIf you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle.\u201d", "The Weather Service said that the blizzard was expected to deliver wind gusts of over 100 miles per hour and that the snow was expected to last until Sunday at 6 a.m. local time.", "The same storm system responsible for the blizzard had also brought rain to the region, a welcome sight in the Big Island, which has been hit by a severe drought.", "But there was also potential for flooding, and the Weather Service issued a flood watch for the whole island chain through Tuesday.", "\u201cThe blizzard is grabbing the national attention, but it\u2019s not as impactful as the rain,\u201d said Tom Birchard, a senior forecaster with the service.", "Adam Weintraub, a spokesman for the Hawaii Emergency Management Agency, said that little of the mountains\u2019 surface was developed, so a winter blast comes with \u201ca very limited set of effects, population-wise.\u201d", "\u201cWe\u2019re watching with considerably more concern the rest of the storm system, because it\u2019s got the possibility to produce flash floods and landslides,\u201d he said.", "Ms. Ballard said the cold front also led to lower temperatures than usual in Honolulu.", "The overnight low early Saturday was 55 degrees, according to Mr. Birchard. The last time it had been that cold in December was in 1962, when the temperature fell to 54 degrees.", "\u201cWe are having our version of a chill,\u201d Ms. Ballard said. \u201cI\u2019m looking forward to sleeping today. I\u2019ll get to cuddle under the blankets.\u201d"]
